intro: Mesembryanthemum dasyphyllum, commonly known as the woolly bush, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant features dense, woolly foliage that helps reduce water loss and protect against intense sunlight. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in clusters during the warm season. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
